page.title: 04 Beacon Park
page.content: Beacon Park used to be a very big garden belonging to the Hinkley family. The garden was passed down the family until a man called Swinfen Broun bought it.Before he died in 1948 he gave the 12 acres of land to the city as a park. Beacon Park has a lot of activities like a children's playground, a golf course, football pitches, a children's boating lake and a tennis court. Beacon Park has a lot of monuments and statues. One of these is for the Captain of the Titanic and it has a fountain in it. Beacon Park is very popular on Saturday because people leave their older children there while they do their shopping.
